So I have an assignment for my university class to find a little known painting and describe it in english and I thought maybe you guys could help me?

I want the painting to be sci-fi-ish or have something to do with science. There needs to be at least one person doing something on it. Not just sitting and breathing but actually running, shooting, or whatever a space adventurer might do. Just nothing trippy, please.

I'll be happily giving out rep points for anyone who contributes. Maybe we could even turn this thread into Sci-Fi Art Megathread!

Edited November 15, 2015 by Veeltch

Chesley Bonestell.

Wow, the artist I was going suggest. OK, let's try Robert McCall.

I offer you Han Solo punching a giant alien ferret

(star wars expanded universe got weird)
May I interest you in some german pulp magazine covers? There's also a spin-off if that isn't enough.

Maybe a painting by Alan Bean. The Apollo 12 astronaut makes paintings of his trip to the moon.

http://www.alanbean.com/available_originals.cfm
That's some amazing stuff! Thanks a ton, guys!
I'd suggest the works of Chris Foss, Patrick Woodroffe, Roger Dean, Philip Castle

I offer you the entire atomic rockets website:
[URL]http://www.projectrho.com/public_html/rocket/[/URL]
Filled with sci-fi images.

[quote name='Mad Rocket Scientist']I offer you the entire atomic rockets website ... [/QUOTE]

Funny you should mention that. I follow Winchell's Twitter page online (I don't actually use Twitter) and one time he recommended KSP and indicated that it was on sale on Steam. I got it based on his advice, after having passed it by due to the little green men previously.

Yeah, he mirrors lots of vintage science fiction art!

Eh, I just noticed that it needs to be a realistic paintings so no space ferrets. That sucks :L Thanks anyway guys.

I guess this means Space Art Megathread!
